alert.note: Alert for Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 07 at 12:54PM MDT until June 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MULLEN FIRE BURN SCAR AREA REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wyoming, including the following areas, Snowy Range and Upper North Platte River Basin. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Thunderstorms, some with heavy rainfall, are expected to develop over and near the Snowy Range by late this morning and persisting through the afternoon into the early evening hours. Residents near the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
